剧情与玩法的完美结合。
游戏核心玩法：枪弹射击，魔法释放，收集与能力成长，剧情体验。
游戏优点：令人难忘的NPC伊丽莎白，枪弹与魔法的结合，引人入胜的世界观与优秀的剧情表现，美轮美奂的天空之城哥伦比亚。
游戏缺点：不吹毛求疵的话就是无
生化奇兵系列是喜欢玩FPS类型的玩家绝对不能错过的一个系列，体验一手开枪一手施法的快乐，这种弹药射击与魔法施放，还有本作中利用地图要素进行快速移动的设计，让单纯的FPS游戏有了更加丰富的体验，而除了这个系列的传统特色以外，本作最为值得称道的一点就在于剧情与玩法的完美结合，而实现这一点的，靠的就是一个全程陪同的NPC伊丽莎白，也是整个剧情的核心人物，因为玩家在游戏过程中基本始终是和她在一起的，不是那种到一个点出现，然后过程中完全不见的模式，这种设计让玩家在任何一个瞬间都不会感觉脱离了剧情，正是这种伴随关系，剧情表现和战斗场景的切换几乎没有任何膈应，你甚至觉得半路上打死一个杂兵都是剧情的一部分，这样的设计同时也使得人物前后的转变变得有迹可循，主要人物的人物形象也因为这些改变更加立体丰满起来，也就是说这个设计不仅优化了战斗进入，同时也优化了剧情表现。无限讲了一个关于救赎与成长的故事，主人公身负债务，为了还清这笔钱，奉命去带回一个女孩儿，而当他和这个女孩儿在天空之城经历了种种事情之后，他才发现事情并不简单，一切事情有因必有果，现在他拿到果了，问题是，因是什么？

神作的名号，意味着它独具划时代的开创性，或者将某种要素发挥到了极致以致于极大的提高了后来游戏的标准。
生化奇兵无限最为惊艳的开场以及与伊丽莎白人物的互动设计还有极富寓意的剧情，作为上个世代尾声的游戏可以说都是无限拔高级别。

不过这里要说几点不足：
中期重复探索性较高、趣味性下降——前作差不多的毛病没改；
铁壁将比大老爹压迫感更强，但又过于强，突进速度和攻击间隔都特别短；
怪物种类有点少，出现方式也比较单一；导致异能基本上有最优解，异能的可玩性不如前作；
场景设计以突出世界观为主，非常令人深刻，但弱化了射击体验；反过来导致枪械选择也比较单一——我基本上一路卡宾枪爆头通过... ...
小boss的塑造不如1代，主要问题在于哥伦比亚城的整体氛围并不是销魂城那种腐坏阶段的乌托邦，而尚处于平稳运行的阶段。但制作组却非要营造一种类似的荒诞、诡异的感觉。其实蛮尴尬的...

Apesar de ter ouvido falar do jogo, e das suas críticas em suma muito boas, eu não conhecia a fundo sua história, e começar a jogar essa master peça seguido dos 2 primeiros jogos foi a melhor decisão que eu tomei.
O que me chamou a atenção primeiramente foi sua ambientação num universo steampunk, estilo esse o qual eu queria ver em muitos outros jogos futuramente, pois a harmonia geral desse estilo me cativa de mais. Gostei muito do começo do jogo seguir de uma forma mais lenta, de modo que você possa aproveitar cada detalhe desse universo novo e épico.
A jogabilidade me agradou muito também, ela vai evoluindo conforme o jogo avança e aumentando suas possibilidades de combinações de armas/vigores de forma que não enjoe nem um pouco, isto em colaboração com os inimigos são até que desafiadores (com mérito a Lady Comstock que me deu trabalho jogando no difícil)
Mas o que realmente te pega de jeito é a história, simplesmente sensacional, superou minhas expectativas e ainda me de deixou mal da cabeça no final.
Eu poderia gastar muito mais tempo dizendo tudo que me fez amar esse jogo, mas acredito que cada um tenha que ter sua experiência e tirar suas próprias conclusões. 
Recomendo infitnitamente

[h1]生化奇兵3[/h1]
类型：FPS / 剧情
标志性词汇：伊丽莎白我老婆（并不是我的）

[b]画面：13年极致色彩[/b]
生化奇兵3可谓是一波三折，建模多次更改，再加上2K的脑残操作，从制作组中抽出了一部分成员组成了2K AU也就是做了无主之地前传的工作室，也间接导致了生化奇兵中后期节奏明显略有紧凑，但是制作人还是竭尽全力完成了生化奇兵3，无论是放映机还是各种武器的还原，复古的海报和演出，随处可见制作组是下足了功夫。

总之，游戏年龄稍小的人，大概根本不会相信这是2013年的画质，曾齐肩战地COD，傲视群雄，贴图细致度达到了最高画质开镜才能看出比较清晰的像素化，特效方面也是当年一顶一的强，总结起来——工作室的综合实力绝对能排入2013的工作室前三。

[b]配乐：沉默的复古[/b]
初入天空城，走在大街上，走到一间商店旁，那仿佛是从古董留声机中传来略带沙沙声的20世纪初的味道，玩家身处于哪个时代已经不言而喻。
而这只是冰山一角，游戏前期战斗时的BGM并不喧宾夺主，但足以调动玩家的激情，而中后期的战斗难度激增后，BGM也逐渐变化，变得越来越激烈。

[b]剧情：一场悲剧的轮回[/b]
生化奇兵3的剧情是十分晦涩难懂的，涉及到很多时间线，而主角的旅行也是在时间线之间反复跳跃，常常会让人迷失剧情，但是还好如果仔细听伯克与伊丽莎白的对话的话，这些时间线还是可以理解八九分的。
但是后期的剧情就明显是被2K逼的赶工痕迹，很多细节异常难懂，变成了碎片式信息，需要一定的脑补能力。
由于生化奇兵3的剧情格外复杂，甚至需要一张百余字的图解，所以这里放一下知乎上的解析。
[url=https://www.zhihu.com/question/20939795]生化奇兵剧情相关[/url]

[b]游戏性：枪与魔法[/b]
生化奇兵一贯的特色，枪与魔法，枪械的手感相当带感，升级系统也是有一定的策略性在里面。
至于魔法还是老样子，我搓技能了，一招冲了，没什么好说的，群鸦，火球，闪电，突进，魅惑，磁力盾，多样性的技能让枯燥的枪械战斗马上活了起来，碰上强大的枪械敌人就用磁力盾把子弹扔回去，碰上喜欢跑路的敌人就用突进一头撞上去喷子社保。当然魔法也不是没限制，盐分是主角的魔力槽，盐分不足当然就没法用了——但是这里伊丽莎白的作用就体现出来了，当主角血量盐分不足时，会即时扔来血包和盐瓶补给主角，这也是伊丽莎白成为很多人梦中情人的原因吧~

[b]综评：天鹅之歌[/b]
+丰富的战斗系统
+伊丽莎白！
+填坑完成的世界观
-2K葬送了生化奇兵3成为真正意义上的完美作品

这是一款神作，评价完毕。

«Tout commence toujours... par un phare.»

New York, 1912. Le détective privé Booker Dewitt est mené par un étrange couple sur un phare au large avec une simple missive: «Ramenez-nous la fille et nous effacerons la dette». Au sommet de ce phare, un étrange siège nous attends, avec pour unique destination la cité flottante de Columbia. Malgré ces aspects idylliques, tout ne flotte pas sur des nuages dans cet archipel patriotique. La guerre civile gronde sous le soleil et la route vers Elizabeth ne sera pas de tout repos. Et le retour au bercail encore moins...

Quittant les profondeurs sous-marines des deux premiers opus, Bioskock Infinite nous propulse au-dessus des nuages ensoleillés. L'industrialisation a fait sa marque sur cet archipel sécessionniste décadant ou tout repose sur les bons mots du Prophète Zachary Comstock, lesquels couvrent toutefois le racisme, les propos sectaires et la pauvreté inhérents au monde précédent de peu la Grande Guerre. Retrouvant les mécaniques devenues références de la saga des Bioshock, on devra à nouveau manier nos bonnes vieilles armes à feu, mais également les toniques (équivalent des plasmides) dont les multiples combinaisons nous permettront de venir à bout de nos adversaires. Que ce soit des féroces Handyman de Comstock ou des grenadiers de la Vox Populi de Daisy Fitzroy, notre route va rapidement être semée d'embûches.

Mais c'est sans compter sur quelques bonnes cartes que l'on garde dans notre manche. On pourra ainsi se faufiler à travers le champ de bataille en surfant sur les sky-lines ceinturant les îlots pour nous jeter directement sur la tête de nos ennemis. Ou encore des alliés mécaniques révélés par les failles quantiques ouvertes par l'«agneau» de Comstock. Sans oublier les innombrables coups de main d'Elizabeth en cours de partie, qui nous fournira argent, munitions, soins ou cristaux au cours des affrontements.

Bien que l'on soit loin du photo réalisme, le jeu est visuellement très beau, ne s'éloignant pas trop des sombres couloirs claustrophobiques de Rapture, mais s'en distinguant par les zones ouvertes baignées des chauds rayons du soleil. Il est pratiquement dommage que notre route ne soit pas un parcours de santé nous permettant de nous balader à notre guise. La bande son, réalisée par Garry Schyman, vaut toujours le détour et nous plonge dans l'aventure. Les gramophones dispersés un peu partout vont également nous offrir des chansons d'époque, mais également quelques «covers» des années 80-90 à la sauce années 20.

Seul petit bémol à l'histoire pourrait revenir à la conclusion, qui est un peu expéditive. Alors que l'on nous offre un semblant de choix tout au long du jeu, on se retrouve malheureusement avec une fin où on nous tient la main. Alors que l'on nous envoyait dans une direction, on nous laisse sur notre faim avec une fin qui, à mon avis, ne s'accorde pas totalement avec l'histoire que l'on suivait depuis le début. Mais comme toujours, difficile d'avoir une histoire avec des bonds dans le temps qui tienne complètement la route. On pourra toutefois apprécié le cours passage dans Rapture en fin de partie (qui se prolongera dans les deux Tombeaux Sous-Marin qui feront guise d'Épilogue à nos périples avec Booker et Elizabeth.)

Malgré ce grain de sel, Bioshock Infinite reste un grand jeu que l'on prends toujours autant de plaisir à traverser. Spécialement pour les fans de la saga.

A stunning original world of retro-sci-fi technology and gorgeous scenery. A cast of fully fleshed-out, memorable characters who deliver real emotional impact. A great villain and a greater monster. Infinite comes through as a true, worthy follow-up to BioShock, one of the most-renowned shooters of this generation.

Townsfolk bustle in the plaza streets, birds flit about almost everywhere, and propaganda extols the local prophet's racist, ultra-nationalist beliefs. Columbia has its own history and hierarchy, to a degree that most shooters – or games of any genre, for that matter – can’t even aspire.  All these elements give this fantastical city a sterling sense of genuine place.

This world is easy to buy into because its characters believe in it so convincingly, chief among them our player character, war veteran-turned-PI Booker DeWitt. He's a reluctant hero on a mission, vaguely referred to as a less-than-virtuous man with a shady past. The first hour chronicles DeWitt’s unusual journey to Columbia under orders to recover a teenage girl named Elizabeth so that he might “wipe away the debt.” 


Elizabeth herself, in fact, plays a central role in BioShock Infinite’s story, and in the moment-to-moment experience. Once she’d established herself at my side, any period of separation was noticeable. Not only does the action revert to feeling very much like BioShock 1, but it made me feel as if something was genuinely missing: emotional depth. Over our time together, Elizabeth's expressive performances elicited everything from sympathy to fear and even guilt. She provides motivation and moves the story forward, and like the clear bond the Big Daddies and Little Sisters had in the first game, I was compelled to protect her. And from a purely mechanical perspective, it’s a half-miracle that she never gets in the way – but she doesn't. What's great about Elizabeth is that her presence always adds something, and never takes anything away.

Booker and Elizabeth have a strong supporting cast to work with as well. Almost from the moment Booker arrives on Columbia he's antagonized by Zachary Comstock, aka “The Prophet,” who makes for an easily hateable villain both for his morally reprehensible views on race and for his oddly personal verbal attacks towards Booker over loudspeakers and other communiques. His level of evil and the ways in which he harasses you indirectly are something of a cross between the sadism of System Shock 2’s SHODAN and the manipulation imposed by BioShock’s Andrew Ryan.

From the moment you begin fighting your first barely competent Columbia cops early on, vigors – nee plasmids – bolster your offense with potent table-turners like the target-zapping Shock Jockey or Charge’s directed speed burst. My go-to, Bucking Bronco, floats targets up in the air for a few moments, letting you pick them off like (paralyzed) fish in a barrel. Some vigors are essentially reskinned abilities from the first BioShock, and all are familiar from one game or another; the ability to charge them up to lay them down like mines is the only thing that really sets them apart, though I rarely saw fit to use their secondary functions. But they're a useful toolset, and odds are you’ll find a couple you favor above the others -- particularly in their impressively powerful upgraded forms..............

Going in, I had to question whether Infinite could live up to the BioShock name after having discarded its signature world of Rapture, with its Big Daddies and Little Sisters and warring philosophies, and starting from scratch. On the way out, I'm forced to seriously question which is the better game. In total, BioShock Infinite is a brilliant shooter that nudges the entire genre forward with innovations in both storytelling and gameplay.

[h1] TL;DR 9/10 This is one of the best FPS' of it's time. It has it all; heart pounding battles, good play style variation, responsive and logical controls, beautiful and engaging setting, and an awesome plot. [/h1]

[b] Pros: [/b]
+ unique and attractive setting coupled with a fantastic, anything but cookie cutter, story
+ good variation of enemies with different strengths and weaknesses
+ gear, weapon, and ability options to play the way you'd like

[b] Cons: [/b]
- occasional cringy dialogue by the female protagonist
- very linear

I had to really think about it to come up with cons for this game. As mentioned above, I consider this one of the best FPS I have played, and have returned to it time and time again. The setting is beautiful and very unique. Its outward beauty adds another level to the quiet discomfort of the society that 'thrives' in such a pretty setting. 

The first time I played this game, the story surprised me frequently. I pride myself in my ability to predict what's going to happen next, and this game had me guessing incorrectly quite a bit. If you have not played this game before, DO NOT LOOK UP THE STORY.

This game is very linear, which should be pointed out to manage expectations. For me, this isn't much of a problem as I don't mind playing games that direct the player a bit. The linear progression in this game also does not feel very constrained or claustrophobic as many linear games can. It makes sense with the plot, and the new abilities you gain along the way.

I mentioned 'cringey dialogue' in my cons list, specifically referring to Elizabeth. It really only happens a few times, but basically it feels like whoever wrote Elizabeth couldn't decide if she should be in her 20's or 10 years old. There are a couple of moments in cut-scenes that felt very "ew" for lack of a better word. Gave me the feeling that if somebody walked in on me playing this game, they'd immediately ask "um, wtf are you playing?" I definitely get the vibe from this game was not written with women in mind, as it's heavily focused on the player being the big, white knight, manly hero and her being the poor, helpless, damsel in distress. Not a major problem, but worth mentioning.

All in all, if you have not played this game, do yourself a favor and do so. It's an extremely fun, engaging, thrill ride. The plot will have your head spinning and the fight sequences will have your heart pounding.

Happy gaming!
